alert.note: Alert for Bland; Smyth; Tazewell (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Smyth, southeastern Tazewell and southwestern Bland Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 445 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Asberrys, or 10 miles north of Marion, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marion... Ceres... Mount Rogers National Recreation Area... Nebo... Adwolf... Asberrys... and Hungry Mother State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
